Class ScalerControl

All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener, java.awt.event.ItemListener, java.util.Observer
public class ScalerControl
extends DataControl
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.ItemListener, java.util.Observer

Reads and displays the scaler values.

Since:
JDK1.1
Version:
0.5 April 98
Author:
Ken Swartz

Constructor Summary

          Handles events from checkboxes.
 void read()
          Read the scaler values send out command to read scalers which sould be recieved by VMECommunication VME should then send a command to CAMAC to read the scalers, when VME recieves back the scaler values it calls Distribute event which will call our update method.

 void zero()

setup

public void setup()
Setup the display dialog box. Needs to be called if the list of Scaler objects changes, such as after opening a file, or initializing a sort routine.

Specified by:
setup in class DataControl

setScalers

public void setScalers(int[] scalValue)
Sets the text fields in the scaler display dialog box.

Parameters:
scalValue - array of scaler values, which must map to the array of text fields in the dialog box

read

public void read()
          throws GlobalException
Read the scaler values send out command to read scalers which sould be recieved by VMECommunication VME should then send a command to CAMAC to read the scalers, when VME recieves back the scaler values it calls Distribute event which will call our update method.

GlobalException

zero

public void zero()
          throws GlobalException
zero scalers, call broadcast which will sent it to the class that will zero the camac crate scalers.

GlobalException
